subject: Fix issue when generating code with cfg.OptGroup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-06 20:42:47.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_generator.py', 'oslo_config/generator.py'], 'message': 'Fix issue when generating code with cfg.OptGroup

There seems to be an issue when using oslo-config-generator with
cfg.OptGroup.  It seems the generator was not checking if the group
was an object or not.  Resulting in section names as the following:

  [DEFAULT]

  [<oslo_config.cfg.OptGroup object at 0x325c350>]

Change-Id: I946d55fcd713369dda4cdf490391a75901bded22
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issue when generating code with cfg.OptGroup

There seems to be an issue when using oslo-config-generator with
cfg.OptGroup.  It seems the generator was not checking if the group
was an object or not.  Resulting in section names as the following:

  [DEFAULT]

  [<oslo_config.cfg.OptGroup object at 0x325c350>]

Change-Id: I946d55fcd713369dda4cdf490391a75901bded22
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Use suds-jurko on Python 2
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-05 10:12:19.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'requirements-py3.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Use suds-jurko on Python 2

Replace suds dependency with suds-jurko on Python 2. It was already used
on Python 3.

suds-jurko is actively maintained (latest commit in december 2014) and
supports Python 3, whereas suds doesn't seem to be maintained anymore
(last release in 2010).

suds-jurko is a drop-in replacement for suds, both packages provide the
same Python module.

This change removes requirements-py3.txt because they are no more Python
3 specific dependencies.

It also fixes a bug in packaging: currently, oslo.vmware provides a
single wheel package for Python 2 and Python 3 whereas dependencies are
different. suds is incompatible with Python 3 and so the oslo.vmware
wheel package cannot be installed on Python 3.

requirements-py3.txt contained oslo.serialization and httplib2
dependencies. These dependencies were removed from requirements.txt by
the commit 6d8594ae519e2dfa116f84fb126e40a058473754,
requirements-py3.txt wasn't updated.

Update py33 and py34 test environments in tox.ini to use
requirements.txt instead of requirements-py3.txt.

Change-Id: I699c65e4abd607ea6f377d86c45fd609569f3c2b
"}]
commit_message:
Use suds-jurko on Python 2

Replace suds dependency with suds-jurko on Python 2. It was already used
on Python 3.

suds-jurko is actively maintained (latest commit in december 2014) and
supports Python 3, whereas suds doesn't seem to be maintained anymore
(last release in 2010).

suds-jurko is a drop-in replacement for suds, both packages provide the
same Python module.

This change removes requirements-py3.txt because they are no more Python
3 specific dependencies.

It also fixes a bug in packaging: currently, oslo.vmware provides a
single wheel package for Python 2 and Python 3 whereas dependencies are
different. suds is incompatible with Python 3 and so the oslo.vmware
wheel package cannot be installed on Python 3.

requirements-py3.txt contained oslo.serialization and httplib2
dependencies. These dependencies were removed from requirements.txt by
the commit 6d8594ae519e2dfa116f84fb126e40a058473754,
requirements-py3.txt wasn't updated.

Update py33 and py34 test environments in tox.ini to use
requirements.txt instead of requirements-py3.txt.

Change-Id: I699c65e4abd607ea6f377d86c45fd609569f3c2b

subject: zmq: Add support for ZmqClient pooling
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-26 10:05:11.000000000', 'files': ['tests/drivers/test_impl_zmq.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/base.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_zmq.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_qpid.py', 'oslo_messaging/opts.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_zmq.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'zmq: Add support for ZmqClient pooling

To avoid creating a new ZMQ connection for every message sent
to a remote broker, implement pooling and re-use of ZmqClient
objects and associated ZMQ context.

A pool is created for each remote endpoint (keyed by address);
the size of each pool is configured using rpc_conn_pool_size.

All outbound message client connections are pooled.

Closes-Bug: 1384113
Change-Id: Ia55d5c310a56e51df5e2f5d39e561a4da3fe4d83
'}]
commit_message:
zmq: Add support for ZmqClient pooling

To avoid creating a new ZMQ connection for every message sent
to a remote broker, implement pooling and re-use of ZmqClient
objects and associated ZMQ context.

A pool is created for each remote endpoint (keyed by address);
the size of each pool is configured using rpc_conn_pool_size.

All outbound message client connections are pooled.

Closes-Bug: 1384113
Change-Id: Ia55d5c310a56e51df5e2f5d39e561a4da3fe4d83

subject: Update response body when healthcheck is available
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-24 08:10:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/tests/test_healthcheck.py', 'oslo_middleware/healthcheck/disable_by_file.py'], 'message': 'Update response body when healthcheck is available

According to the Healthcheck documentation [1]_ the 200 response returns
"OK" as the body if none of the backends report an application issue.
Current implementation returns empty body which is confusing, so it has
been updated to cover the docs.

[1]
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/api.html#oslo_middleware.Healthcheck

Change-Id: I5fb9045112658ef74b8a831bc7814f30c9f42053
Closes-bug: 1414646
'}]
commit_message:
Update response body when healthcheck is available

According to the Healthcheck documentation [1]_ the 200 response returns
"OK" as the body if none of the backends report an application issue.
Current implementation returns empty body which is confusing, so it has
been updated to cover the docs.

[1]
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/api.html#oslo_middleware.Healthcheck

Change-Id: I5fb9045112658ef74b8a831bc7814f30c9f42053
Closes-bug: 1414646

import webob.exc

commit_message:
Adds missing WebOb in requirements.txt

Unit tests are failing without it, and the file
oslo_versionedobjects/exception.py has:
import webob.exc

So it's looking like webob is missing from requirements.txt.
This patch fixes that. Note that this should be fixed in
the kilo branch later on.

Change-Id: Ib0ac48aeea4f8413740af89340e3b094312fa6b4

commit_message:
Add iSCSI protocol support for IBM FlashSystem.

This change implements iSCSI protocol for Cinder driver.
It communicates with IBM FlashSystem using SSH management interface.
It supports all required driver features.

Implements: blueprint ibm-flashsystem-driver-iscsi
Change-Id: I25f8ae0e1b67b1f65e2accebbd9dd978d11a5037

Add ASG batch hook proposal

AutoScalingGroup batch hooks are intended to let users step through
rolling updates with hooks as they already can with individual
resources.

commit_message:
API/Object: Remove _get_flavor in simple_tenant_usage api

As we move flavor out from instance.system_metadata to a filed of instance,
now we can simple use instance.flavor to get the flavor, and we don't need to
care about if instance is deleted or not, do we?

Related to blueprint kilo-objects
Change-Id: Icd0a00283ea1a941e51ded750cc2e29795e252d6

subject: Port service to Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-27 16:12:40.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/service.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Port service to Python 3

Fix ProcessLauncher._pipe_watcher() on Python 3. On Python 3,
eventlet.greenio.GreenPipe.read() requires a length parameter. Reading
one byte is enough to be notified when the parent dies unexpectedly.

Fix _is_daemon() on Python 3: catch io.UnsupportedOperation before
catching OSError because io.UnsupportedOperation now inherits from
OSError in Python 3. By the way, the comment was wrong: the io module
exists in Python 2.6.

Remove whitelist of tests working Python 3 from tox.ini since all tests
now pass on Python 3.

Change-Id: Iba8b35e535cd0d869f87f5b790243cf9c0728de8
'}]
commit_message:
Port service to Python 3

Fix ProcessLauncher._pipe_watcher() on Python 3. On Python 3,
eventlet.greenio.GreenPipe.read() requires a length parameter. Reading
one byte is enough to be notified when the parent dies unexpectedly.

Fix _is_daemon() on Python 3: catch io.UnsupportedOperation before
catching OSError because io.UnsupportedOperation now inherits from
OSError in Python 3. By the way, the comment was wrong: the io module
exists in Python 2.6.

Remove whitelist of tests working Python 3 from tox.ini since all tests
now pass on Python 3.

Change-Id: Iba8b35e535cd0d869f87f5b790243cf9c0728de8

commit_message:
Scale-out and pid support for Manage Service listing

Adds pagination, sorting and filtering capability to
'Manage service' listing feature to support scale-out
heat-engine deployments.

It also adds pid for each of the heat-engine reported
by 'manage service' APIs and CLIs.

Implements blueprint heat-manage-service-list-scale-out
APIImpact

Change-Id: I336a6127512174ecf96074b08dfda6bcefcfdb39

commit_message:
Update rc manifest parsing according to v1beta3

Now that Kubernetes 0.15.0 release is supported and it has
v1beta3, the manifest structure has changed from v1beta1 to
v1beta3. This change implements the v1beta3 manifest parsing
logic for rc resource of Kubernetes.

Change-Id: I54aa0502c6d9a58652623800e02766ad5b09b159
Partially-Implements: blueprint python-k8sclient

commit_message:
Update service manifest parsing according to v1beta3

Now that Kubernetes 0.15.0 release is supported and it has
v1beta3, the manifest structure has changed from v1beta1 to
v1beta3. This change implements the v1beta3 manifest parsing
logic for service resource of Kubernetes.

Change-Id: I1200473f91118eaa48b1cec386f30cf8a50708b5
Partially-Implements: blueprint python-k8sclient

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-06 09:52:31.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_resource.py'], 'message': 'Use action in check_*_complete method

Previously action paramater was used only for checking DELETE state,
when resource can not be found. This patch add condition for other
states. F.e. when nested resource was in INIT_COMPLETE state, we should
make sure, that state was changed to CREATE_* state.

Change-Id: Ia5c429716f43b6cc8b7155fbf1ddc0c0a9369727
Related-Bug: #1433340
'}]
commit_message:
Use action in check_*_complete method

Previously action paramater was used only for checking DELETE state,
when resource can not be found. This patch add condition for other
states. F.e. when nested resource was in INIT_COMPLETE state, we should
make sure, that state was changed to CREATE_* state.

Change-Id: Ia5c429716f43b6cc8b7155fbf1ddc0c0a9369727
Related-Bug: #1433340

The pbr 0.11.0 release has shown that having multiple trees in a repo
each with their on version that is different to the git history is
really not going to work.

This change means that the version will be derived from git history,
which will still be useful for operators managing what version of a
plugin they have installed.

Running sudo python setup.py install (as documented) is known to work

Change-Id: I716a5374bb283d11e26459b5866a0437ab6fe0dd
Closes-Bug: #1450733

commit_message:
Do not specify version for contrib plugins

The pbr 0.11.0 release has shown that having multiple trees in a repo
each with their on version that is different to the git history is
really not going to work.

This change means that the version will be derived from git history,
which will still be useful for operators managing what version of a
plugin they have installed.

Running sudo python setup.py install (as documented) is known to work
with the latest pbr.

Change-Id: I716a5374bb283d11e26459b5866a0437ab6fe0dd
Closes-Bug: #1450733

commit_message:
WIP: Configure neutron for network topology changes

The config-neutron.sh script was not completely configuring
the correct nova credentials for neutron to notify nova of
configuration changes.  This was noticed by looking at the
log output during startup of the neutron-server container
and noticing the config variables were not being set.

This isn't quite right yet - so please don't approve.

Change-Id: I1ecc024aee83bf3bf02eb6da45418d0106e859ec

commit_message:
Add toggle to run Nova API and EC2-API under Apache2

Inspired by keystone and rcbops-cookbooks's nova scripts,
this review adds apache2 templates for two of the Nova
services. Also add code in lib/nova to switch between
the old and new ways to these two services. The patch
depends on the Nova review mentioned below as the two
scripts that are needed will be in Nova's repository.

TODO for later would be to switch on NOVA_USE_MOD_WSGI
when ENABLE_HTTPD_MOD_WSGI_SERVICES is switched on.

Related Nova blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/run-nova-services-under-apache2

Depends-On: Idd7d3d1b3cc5770cdecea7afe6db3c89d5b2c0d0
Change-Id: I9fc0c601db2776d3e9084be84065e728e3f5d414

subject: Fix wrong `sudo ceph -c` command in lib/ceph
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-08 17:19:43.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ceph'], 'message': 'Fix wrong `sudo ceph -c` command in lib/ceph

The `sudo -c ${CEPH_CONF_FILE} ceph ...` in lib/ceph misplaced
`ceph`. The correct syntax is `sudo ceph -c ${CEPH_CONF_FILE} ...`,
see lib/ceph:308.

While installing ./stack.sh with ceph enabled, the above malformed
command raises a `usage: sudo -h | -K | -k | -V ...` error and stops
the installation.

This patch fixes `sudo -c ${CEPH_CONF_FILE} ceph ...` by moving
`ceph` to the right place.

Change-Id: I3da943d5a353d99b09787f804b79c1d006a09d96
Closes-bug: #1453055
'}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong `sudo ceph -c` command in lib/ceph

The `sudo -c ${CEPH_CONF_FILE} ceph ...` in lib/ceph misplaced
`ceph`. The correct syntax is `sudo ceph -c ${CEPH_CONF_FILE} ...`,
see lib/ceph:308.

While installing ./stack.sh with ceph enabled, the above malformed
command raises a `usage: sudo -h | -K | -k | -V ...` error and stops
the installation.

This patch fixes `sudo -c ${CEPH_CONF_FILE} ceph ...` by moving
`ceph` to the right place.

Change-Id: I3da943d5a353d99b09787f804b79c1d006a09d96
Closes-bug: #1453055

commit_message:
Add local.sh to dev guides

This will configure devstack to automatically set up NAT properly
on br-ex after ./stack.sh sets up devstack. This allows instances
spawned by Nova to access the internet.

Change-Id: Ide25f8b5770f808fe39da329597cc8e4024fba41
Closes-Bug: #1446372

commit_message:
Configure minions properly

A previus commit introduced a regression which caused kubectl not
to configure properly.  This results in kube minions staying in the
NotReady state and this script not completing execution.

Change-Id: I336c21ac2660c4c19c401b8ecbd8015cc44dbfdd
Closes-Bug: #1453470

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-09 22:22:25.000000000', 'files': ['docker/nova-controller/nova-novncproxy/Dockerfile'], 'message': 'Make novnc proxy work on Icehouse

Icehosue websockify is incompatible with 0.6.0 which comes from
the default repos.  Manually remove it in the novnc container and
install websockify 0.5.1 from koji.

Change-Id: I62435f0bc51773cebadf95184278af64f0c2847b
'}]
commit_message:
Make novnc proxy work on Icehouse

Icehosue websockify is incompatible with 0.6.0 which comes from
the default repos.  Manually remove it in the novnc container and
install websockify 0.5.1 from koji.

Change-Id: I62435f0bc51773cebadf95184278af64f0c2847b

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-06 13:11:57.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/zonemanager/utils.py', 'cinder/zonemanager/drivers/brocade/brcd_fabric_opts.py', 'cinder/zonemanager/drivers/brocade/brcd_fc_zone_driver.py', 'cinder/zonemanager/drivers/cisco/cisco_fc_san_lookup_service.py', 'cinder/zonemanager/fc_san_lookup_service.py', 'cinder/zonemanager/drivers/cisco/cisco_fc_zone_client_cli.py', 'cinder/hacking/checks.py', 'cinder/zonemanager/drivers/brocade/brcd_fc_san_lookup_service.py', 'cinder/zonemanager/drivers/cisco/cisco_fc_zone_driver.py', 'cinder/zonemanager/fc_zone_manager.py', 'cinder/zonemanager/drivers/brocade/brcd_fc_zone_client_cli.py'], 'message': 'Logging not using oslo.i18n guidelines (zonemgr)

Multi-patch set for easier chunks. This one addresses
the zonemanager cinder directory.

There have been quite a few instances found where the
i18n guidelines are not being followed. I believe this
has helped lead to some of the confusion around how to
correctly do this. Other developers see this code and
assume it is an example of the correct usage.

This patch attempts to clean up most of those violations
in the existing codebase to hopefully help avoid some of
that confusion in reviews.

Some issues address:
* Correct log translation markers for different log levels
* Passing format values as arguments to call, not preformatting
* Not forcing translation via six.text_type and others

Guidelines can be found here:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Hacking checks will not be able to identify all violations of
the guidelines, but it could be useful for catching obvious
one such as LOG.info("No markers!").

Change-Id: I992234cdbe3ac8c59d4c6a6c5362b009162ba38a
Partial-bug: 1433216
'}]
commit_message:
Logging not using oslo.i18n guidelines (zonemgr)

Multi-patch set for easier chunks. This one addresses
the zonemanager cinder directory.

There have been quite a few instances found where the
i18n guidelines are not being followed. I believe this
has helped lead to some of the confusion around how to
correctly do this. Other developers see this code and
assume it is an example of the correct usage.

This patch attempts to clean up most of those violations
in the existing codebase to hopefully help avoid some of
that confusion in reviews.

Some issues address:
* Correct log translation markers for different log levels
* Passing format values as arguments to call, not preformatting
* Not forcing translation via six.text_type and others

Guidelines can be found here:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Hacking checks will not be able to identify all violations of
the guidelines, but it could be useful for catching obvious
one such as LOG.info("No markers!").

Change-Id: I992234cdbe3ac8c59d4c6a6c5362b009162ba38a
Partial-bug: 1433216

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-08 14:12:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Update kilo version alias

Kilo actually sends 4.0 by default and can support 3.x and 4.x messages.
Deployers upgrading from Juno->Kilo can set the compute upgrade level to
'juno' until all nodes are upgraded to kilo and then unset the pin. When
moving to Liberty, setting the level to 'kilo' will use 4.x messages as
Liberty does not support 3.x anymore.

Note that this changes all the use of the kilo alias in test_rpcapi to
just use 3.40 (what it was before). This makes the tests pass (because
it's the same as we're expecting) for the backport. These tests are
removed in the next patch anyway.

UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: Ibbe83879ee1ccfab582119b1e2e588f0471020e2
"}]
commit_message:
Update kilo version alias

Kilo actually sends 4.0 by default and can support 3.x and 4.x messages.
Deployers upgrading from Juno->Kilo can set the compute upgrade level to
'juno' until all nodes are upgraded to kilo and then unset the pin. When
moving to Liberty, setting the level to 'kilo' will use 4.x messages as
Liberty does not support 3.x anymore.

Note that this changes all the use of the kilo alias in test_rpcapi to
just use 3.40 (what it was before). This makes the tests pass (because
it's the same as we're expecting) for the backport. These tests are
removed in the next patch anyway.

UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: Ibbe83879ee1ccfab582119b1e2e588f0471020e2

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-27 15:31:27.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/accounts.py'], 'message': "Fix a bug where a set is indexed as a list.

Previously, the set of hashes returned by _get_match_hash_list(roles)
was being accessed as a list or dict. This was causing an exception
to be thrown as sets don't have indexed access. This patch converts

owner_name: Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)
commit_message:
Fix a bug where a set is indexed as a list.

Previously, the set of hashes returned by _get_match_hash_list(roles)
was being accessed as a list or dict. This was causing an exception
to be thrown as sets don't have indexed access. This patch converts
the set to a list which can be indexed.

Change-Id: I7211f8c3f6f4db1c27a39e91a7b903843180116c

subject: Fix apache2 error
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-05-10 13:54:46.000000000', 'files': ['labs/scripts/ubuntu/setup_horizon.sh', 'labs/scripts/ubuntu/apt_init.sh', 'labs/scripts/setup_lbaas_controller.sh'], 'message': 'Fix apache2 error

Apache2 service was not restarting properly since Ubuntu14.04
which resulted in race conditions. This is explained in detail in the
script. Adds a work around to fix apache2 race invoked by lack of
www-browser virtual package linking to a basic text browser. Adding
w3m before hand to avoid any future issues. Ofcourse lynx or links
works here too.

Also provides more systematic stopping and starting of apache service
for eliminating restart/start-stop race issues.

Change-Id: I541d5b27bbfdda9b9f3eda72a0f13e9e8333faa2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix apache2 error

Apache2 service was not restarting properly since Ubuntu14.04
which resulted in race conditions. This is explained in detail in the
script. Adds a work around to fix apache2 race invoked by lack of
www-browser virtual package linking to a basic text browser. Adding
w3m before hand to avoid any future issues. Ofcourse lynx or links
works here too.

Also provides more systematic stopping and starting of apache service
for eliminating restart/start-stop race issues.

Change-Id: I541d5b27bbfdda9b9f3eda72a0f13e9e8333faa2

subject: Changes exit status for heat_network unit test
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-05-10 13:51:04.000000000', 'files': ['labs/scripts/ubuntu/setup_heat_network.sh'], 'message': 'Changes exit status for heat_network unit test

If the test fails, it should exit the script not the cluster. Just
reporting this error and gracefully exiting the script should be
sufficient. My reasons for this are:

    * The tests are not completely reliable to say if the cluster is
      broken for sure.
    * The tests are not meant to fix the issues with the cluster, it
      could be a packaging issue or bug in the product. Our aim is
      not to catch them.
    * If there is a problem with heat, the other servies are still
      running fine. And the cluster is still usable.

Change-Id: I246bd3144189eba69a64ad545e6fe123e310595e
'}]
commit_message:
Changes exit status for heat_network unit test

If the test fails, it should exit the script not the cluster. Just
reporting this error and gracefully exiting the script should be
sufficient. My reasons for this are:

    * The tests are not completely reliable to say if the cluster is
      broken for sure.
    * The tests are not meant to fix the issues with the cluster, it
      could be a packaging issue or bug in the product. Our aim is
      not to catch them.
    * If there is a problem with heat, the other servies are still
      running fine. And the cluster is still usable.

Change-Id: I246bd3144189eba69a64ad545e6fe123e310595e

subject: Refactor: extract echo_app from enclosing class
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-06 13:29:13.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/echo/service.py'], 'message': 'Refactor: extract echo_app from enclosing class

This allows the echo WSGI app itself to be consumed directly by external
users (such as in a real deployment with Apache httpd), rather than
being run by wsgiref.

This also corrects the position of the docstring, which described
echo_app (a WSGI app), not EchoService (which served the app).

Change-Id: Ic3c69ad8bb08e4d45f5e2b8114b09ae10770161a
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor: extract echo_app from enclosing class

This allows the echo WSGI app itself to be consumed directly by external
users (such as in a real deployment with Apache httpd), rather than
being run by wsgiref.

This also corrects the position of the docstring, which described
echo_app (a WSGI app), not EchoService (which served the app).

Change-Id: Ic3c69ad8bb08e4d45f5e2b8114b09ae10770161a

Currently designate allows to identify a resource only by its id. This

commit_message:
Allow to use domain names instead of ids

Currently designate allows to identify a resource only by its id. This
change allows to identify domains by name or id. This change defines
the method find_resourceid_by_name_or_id which could be reused to
identify other resources by name or id.

Change-Id: I8e64cdbc5572623d05781d0c4e735ff0c429ea91
Closes-Bug: #1443858

commit_message:
Refactor _create_attribute_statement IdP method

Create an inner function to build the attributes so we avoid
to repeat the same commands for each attribute.

Using append() to add a single value has the same effect as
assigning the attribute directly.

Change-Id: I5e60d1771c05ab53f31fcce2c0e6c4ab36dcde62

commit_message:
labs: Adds telemetry service to osbash

Following actions are performed by this patch:
1) Adds the ceilometer packages to the pre-download script.
2) Adds telemetry services on controller node.
3) Configures glance, cinder to send notification to the telemetry module.
4) Adds ceilometer compute agent on compute node.

Co-authored-by: Pranav Salunke <dguitarbite@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I82e8f4799e724e09748bb9c743ec8b77e82af39a

commit_message:
Update from global-requirements.txt and fix cli tests

Commit ID from openstack/requirements:
40b86ac9cb707ff97f5b140d4f5fe5f1dcbbb2ed

There are a few changes in how CLI client is setup in functional
tests after tempest-lib updated to 0.5. A temporary workaround
is introduced to overcome lack of current configuration of CLI
client tests. Next step - move CLI tests to python-muranoclient
since this is a common direction in community.

subject: labs: print stack-list in error case
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-26 18:07:38.000000000', 'files': ['labs/scripts/ubuntu/setup_heat_network.sh'], 'message': 'labs: print stack-list in error case

setup_heat_network.sh aborts if the status is not CREATE_COMPLETE after
60 seconds. With this patch, the script prints the current stack list
before aborting so the user can see the current status of the stack
(which might be CREATE_IN_PROGRESS or CREATE_FAILED).

Change-Id: I23484ef5dfcc6e5681931b58fba0edef1003ff77
'}]
commit_message:
labs: print stack-list in error case

setup_heat_network.sh aborts if the status is not CREATE_COMPLETE after
60 seconds. With this patch, the script prints the current stack list
before aborting so the user can see the current status of the stack
(which might be CREATE_IN_PROGRESS or CREATE_FAILED).

Change-Id: I23484ef5dfcc6e5681931b58fba0edef1003ff77

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-06 19:30:26.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient_saml2/tests/base.py', 'keystoneclient_saml2/i18n.py', 'keystoneclient_saml2/v3/saml2.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I32767615b2d678b6ce545722b6b9d1704cb1ffb4
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I32767615b2d678b6ce545722b6b9d1704cb1ffb4

subject: labs: protect downloader.js from deletion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-19 16:00:53.000000000', 'files': ['labs/lib/wbatch/template-begin_base_bat', 'labs/tools/downloader.js', 'labs/lib/wbatch/template-mkdirs_bat'], 'message': 'labs: protect downloader.js from deletion

In its current location, the download helper for Window batch scripts,
downloader.js, gets deleted when the Windows batch scripts are generated
(due to a call to clean_dir).

This patch moves downloader.js to the tools directory where it remains
safe from clean_dir.

Change-Id: I48f3daf613e8517dfb9256af298e9e43f76289bc
'}]
commit_message:
labs: protect downloader.js from deletion

In its current location, the download helper for Window batch scripts,
downloader.js, gets deleted when the Windows batch scripts are generated
(due to a call to clean_dir).

This patch moves downloader.js to the tools directory where it remains
safe from clean_dir.

Change-Id: I48f3daf613e8517dfb9256af298e9e43f76289bc

commit_message:
Replace "openstack.org" with "www.openstack.org"

The former address redirects (i.e. HTTP 301) to the latter. Doing this
replacement throughout the openstack-manuals/www folder. This change
grew out of a discussion in Change-Id
I38bd0f00d28f7fffffea8531fb70669e37fa2eec.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-08 08:09:29.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/api/middleware/trust.py', 'devstack/lib/senlin', 'tools/setup-service'], 'message': "Fix admin requirement in trust middleware

Due to default policy.json settings in Keystone, a non-admin user is not
allowed to call 'list_users' or 'get_user' APIs. However, Senlin only
knows the user name but it needs a user ID to create the trust between
service requester and the 'senlin' user. The only workaround today is to
have Senlin query its own user ID using its user name. After this is
done, the trust middleware will use the service requester's credential
to raise the 'trust create' request to Keystone.

This necessitates two changes to the current code, one is to relax
Keystone's policy setting to allow a user with 'service' role to do user
list and user get (proposed here: https://review.openstack.org/181298);
the other one is to have Senlin trust middleware to raise user ID
checking request using 'senlin' credential.  This patch contains the
second part.

Since devstack doesn't provide a function to modify default policy
settings, we will wait to see if the patch to Keystone will be accepted.
If Keystone refuse to accept that change, we need to hack the devstack
plugin and 'setup-service' tool to modify the policy.json file.

Anyway, we need 'senlin' user to have a 'service' role in the
requester's domain (default to 'demo').

Change-Id: I87146a54f79e32a9175755f42da1e4406842c0b7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix admin requirement in trust middleware

Due to default policy.json settings in Keystone, a non-admin user is not
allowed to call 'list_users' or 'get_user' APIs. However, Senlin only
knows the user name but it needs a user ID to create the trust between
service requester and the 'senlin' user. The only workaround today is to
have Senlin query its own user ID using its user name. After this is
done, the trust middleware will use the service requester's credential
to raise the 'trust create' request to Keystone.

This necessitates two changes to the current code, one is to relax
Keystone's policy setting to allow a user with 'service' role to do user
list and user get (proposed here: https://review.openstack.org/181298);
the other one is to have Senlin trust middleware to raise user ID
checking request using 'senlin' credential.  This patch contains the
second part.

Since devstack doesn't provide a function to modify default policy
settings, we will wait to see if the patch to Keystone will be accepted.
If Keystone refuse to accept that change, we need to hack the devstack
plugin and 'setup-service' tool to modify the policy.json file.

Anyway, we need 'senlin' user to have a 'service' role in the
requester's domain (default to 'demo').

Change-Id: I87146a54f79e32a9175755f42da1e4406842c0b7

commit_message:
Clean module names in openstack-common.conf

A patch of oslo-incubator[1] can do integrity check for copied
modules from oslo-incubator[2].
This commit fixes these violations.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76901/
[2]http://paste.openstack.org/show/192244/

Change-Id: Ifb94804af34df3e3843668b818d05d37b5cf85aa

commit_message:
Update some tools from oslo-incubator

We can must use update.sh -script ${script path} to update tools
from oslo-incubator if we don't include these scripts in
openstack-common.conf. This commit adds these scripts in the file
and update the latest tools from oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: I219158e618b6090e9046dc32fecdfca059b14562

subject: Fix multipath device discovery when UFN is enabled.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-08 16:20:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_linuxscsi.py', 'nova/storage/linuxscsi.py'], 'message': 'Fix multipath device discovery when UFN is enabled.

This currently returns an invalid path of `/dev/mapper/${WWID}`
when UFN is enabled leading to failures later on when we attempt to
use the volume.

The output of `multipath -l /dev/${path_device}` should always list
the correct device identifier to use with this path as the first
word on the first line.

Closes-Bug: 1401799
Change-Id: I07957fe43e68a55ece10343a6cee83a9ab7148a8
(cherry picked from commit e82b39baa4ef382415d54dc85b99fc2554ac56a7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix multipath device discovery when UFN is enabled.

This currently returns an invalid path of `/dev/mapper/${WWID}`
when UFN is enabled leading to failures later on when we attempt to
use the volume.

The output of `multipath -l /dev/${path_device}` should always list
the correct device identifier to use with this path as the first
word on the first line.

Closes-Bug: 1401799
Change-Id: I07957fe43e68a55ece10343a6cee83a9ab7148a8
(cherry picked from commit e82b39baa4ef382415d54dc85b99fc2554ac56a7)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-10 08:04:46.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/initiator/linuxscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/brick/test_brick_linuxscsi.py'], 'message': 'Multipath commands with error messages in stdout fail to parse

This change fixes an issue in find_multipath_device() where the command
output of ‘multipath -l <device>’ would sometimes fail to be parsed if
there were error messages in the stdout string in addition to the
expected output. We will now strip out the error messages before we
attempt to parse the lines.

Change-Id: I3d48debc7d64f6a891ac37d4c2c5ebddfb5b00b0
Closes-Bug: #1380742
(cherry picked from commit 0b84027204d94e7b314bce505e59aa0c336af43c)
'}]
commit_message:
Multipath commands with error messages in stdout fail to parse

This change fixes an issue in find_multipath_device() where the command
output of ‘multipath -l <device>’ would sometimes fail to be parsed if
there were error messages in the stdout string in addition to the
expected output. We will now strip out the error messages before we
attempt to parse the lines.

Change-Id: I3d48debc7d64f6a891ac37d4c2c5ebddfb5b00b0
Closes-Bug: #1380742
(cherry picked from commit 0b84027204d94e7b314bce505e59aa0c336af43c)

subject: Do not fail on publishing command
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-09 18:42:13.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Do not fail on publishing command

If no documents are published to /draft, the "cp -a" would fail, rewrite
it so that it always succeeds.

If any command fails, nothing gets uploaded ;(

Change-Id: Ib9c6254504f868fd1a8eb772d5df9651448adc42
'}]
commit_message:
Do not fail on publishing command

If no documents are published to /draft, the "cp -a" would fail, rewrite
it so that it always succeeds.

If any command fails, nothing gets uploaded ;(

Change-Id: Ib9c6254504f868fd1a8eb772d5df9651448adc42

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-04-24 17:04:00.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/contrib/volume_encryption_metadata.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_volume_encryption_metadata.py'], 'message': 'Remove unnecessary checks for encrypted types

Change I6ba62a58ac62a3b7bfb2b9d4d18b37ef458b616c makes it unnecessary
to explicitly check that a volume is encrypted prior to invoking the
volume_encryption_metadata_get function. This change cleans up the
single existing invocation of that function in the API contrib
modules. The unit tests are also updated to reflect this change.

Change-Id: I3b8aef67bd6e70f570a39c90175ae6ceaedc4386
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary checks for encrypted types

Change I6ba62a58ac62a3b7bfb2b9d4d18b37ef458b616c makes it unnecessary
to explicitly check that a volume is encrypted prior to invoking the
volume_encryption_metadata_get function. This change cleans up the
single existing invocation of that function in the API contrib
modules. The unit tests are also updated to reflect this change.

Change-Id: I3b8aef67bd6e70f570a39c90175ae6ceaedc4386

commit_message:
Use a small coroutine in the conductor to iterate over jobs

Move the code that sets/clears the stop event, waits on the timeout
and iterates over jobs to its own miniature coroutine and have
the main run() method call into that instead. This makes the run
method more clear by moving the code that does the checks to its
own routine; making the run method just handle dispatches and
dispatch outcomes.

Change-Id: Ic393207ddfc333cc3e92825d34db7ca2e143c072

subject: Make kubectl use internal apiserver address
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-10 01:34:39.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/templates/heat-kubernetes/kubecluster.yaml'], 'message': 'Make kubectl use internal apiserver address

The kubectl tool should not use the floating IP address to communicate with
the rest of Kubernetes.  While this works in devstack with masquarade rules,
it does not work in real production environments.  The first step is to
expose the internal address via heat outputs so we can access it via kubectl.

Change-Id: I29ea29f5ea2e32b70ad2831b46e1c4ec975dfd0a
Partial-Bug: #1453472
'}]
commit_message:
Make kubectl use internal apiserver address

The kubectl tool should not use the floating IP address to communicate with
the rest of Kubernetes.  While this works in devstack with masquarade rules,
it does not work in real production environments.  The first step is to
expose the internal address via heat outputs so we can access it via kubectl.

Change-Id: I29ea29f5ea2e32b70ad2831b46e1c4ec975dfd0a
Partial-Bug: #1453472

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-30 23:47:55.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/context.py', 'heat/common/heat_keystoneclient.py', 'heat/tests/test_auth_password.py', 'heat/common/config.py'], 'message': "Decouple trustee user from keystone_authtoken

This change moves the configuration of the trustee user used in the
trusts deferred auth method to explicit configuration items in
heat.conf, to reduce coupling with keystone's keystone_authtoken
configuration. The keystone_authtoken user is now only used if an
explicit trustee user isn't configured. In addition to this change, heat
can work with keystone_authtoken.auth_uri setting that does not have a
version.

Change-Id: Ifc6e17e2b66006edeada44fe77a16cc511030a86
Closes-Bug: #1446918
"}]
commit_message:
Decouple trustee user from keystone_authtoken

This change moves the configuration of the trustee user used in the
trusts deferred auth method to explicit configuration items in
heat.conf, to reduce coupling with keystone's keystone_authtoken
configuration. The keystone_authtoken user is now only used if an
explicit trustee user isn't configured. In addition to this change, heat
can work with keystone_authtoken.auth_uri setting that does not have a
version.

Change-Id: Ifc6e17e2b66006edeada44fe77a16cc511030a86
Closes-Bug: #1446918

commit_message:
Limit router gw ports' stateful fixed IPs to one per address family

Validate a router's gateway port during a router update by ensuring
it has no more than one v4 fixed IP and one v6 (statefully-assigned)
fixed IP.

Note that there is no limit on v6 addresses from SLAAC and
DHCPv6-stateless subnets as they are automatically allocated.

Change-Id: I6a328048b99af39ab9497fd9f265d1a9b95b7148
Closes-Bug: 1438819
Partially-implements: blueprint multiple-ipv6-prefixes

Since the log files are not required for the services to start,
this patch removes the parameter requirement from both start

Change-Id: I5bfc3ec95875e0db8c533028e2d9b888b1b6c757
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Nova NOVNC and Consoleauth Startup Failure

Previously these services would not start because the start
script requires the associated log file to exist. The default
settings for these 2 log files are blank causing the failure.
Since the log files are not required for the services to start,
this patch removes the parameter requirement from both start
scripts.

(cherry picked from commit 8b6d7b44b8a5adb6078ab3ffa1ddec67968e5699)

Change-Id: I5bfc3ec95875e0db8c533028e2d9b888b1b6c757

commit_message:
Add a novnc container running the novnc-proxy.

All VNC-specific configuration bits are moved from nova-api-base to
nova-compute and the new nova-novncproxy and nova-consoleauth
containers. The compose specification has been updated to reflect this.

A future patch will make the desired backend configurable (spice/vnc).

Blueprint: novnc-container
(cherry picked from commit 5ffc66cd69e1cda087056da25ab25548dacb1d32)

Change-Id: I2e5684378f6e279c69d6a2898f1ac6212799e3dd

Add variables for the following 3 nova.conf vars:
max_overflow (default 10)
max_pool_size (default 5)
pool_timeout (default 30)

This allows for sql tuning to better support bulk operations
(boot/delete) with the ability to define custom values in nova.conf
based on business needs.

Change-Id: Ic427e6822f636a304cbbfaab5ac74a13e912da0f
Closes-Bug: #1447389
'}]
commit_message:
Allow configuration of Nova SQLAlchemy options

Add variables for the following 3 nova.conf vars:
max_overflow (default 10)
max_pool_size (default 5)
pool_timeout (default 30)

This allows for sql tuning to better support bulk operations
(boot/delete) with the ability to define custom values in nova.conf
based on business needs.

Change-Id: Ic427e6822f636a304cbbfaab5ac74a13e912da0f
Closes-Bug: #1447389

subject: Optionally do caching/updating of flowdetail in storage
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-31 01:08:02.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/storage.py'], 'message': 'Optionally do caching/updating of flowdetail in storage

Instead of having the provided flowdetail be a write-through cache-like
object have the storage layer just optionally defer to the backend storage
layer to do this type of caching (if it so prefers/desires to) so that
this layer becomes simpler and is more resistent to bugs and is more easy
to understand/read.

Part of blueprint lb-not-collections

Change-Id: I36db13dc4c762fa6099e3438a649d13f3161cf00
'}]
commit_message:
Optionally do caching/updating of flowdetail in storage

Instead of having the provided flowdetail be a write-through cache-like
object have the storage layer just optionally defer to the backend storage
layer to do this type of caching (if it so prefers/desires to) so that
this layer becomes simpler and is more resistent to bugs and is more easy
to understand/read.

Part of blueprint lb-not-collections

Change-Id: I36db13dc4c762fa6099e3438a649d13f3161cf00

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-06 19:55:50.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/context.py', 'sahara/openstack/common/fileutils.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I5e4746b58e11bf56957f10517d484c173335dfc9

subject: Expose root cause plugin exceptions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6783, 'name': 'Nathan Reller', 'email': 'nathan.s.reller@gmail.com', 'username': 'rellerreller'}, {'_account_id': 7136, 'name': 'Chad Lung', 'email': 'chad.lung@gmail.com', 'username': 'chadlung'}, {'_account_id': 8623, 'name': 'Kaitlin Farr', 'email': 'kaitlin.farr@jhuapl.edu', 'username': 'kaitlin.farr'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11561, 'name': 'Dave McCowan', 'email': 'dmccowan@cisco.com', 'username': 'dave-mccowan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-10 23:37:59.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/plugin/interface/test_secret_store.py', 'barbican/plugin/crypto/manager.py', 'barbican/plugin/util/utils.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/util/test_utils.py', 'barbican/plugin/interface/secret_store.py', 'barbican/plugin/interface/certificate_manager.py'], 'message': "Expose root cause plugin exceptions

Stevedore was being used to both discover configured plugins and to
create instances of these plugins. If the plugin's __init__() function
raised an exception however, stevedore logged the exception but
otherwise kept processing plugins in the list. The logger also is
disabled so no stack trace is seen in the log file, hence the init
error is swallowed. It wasn't until the plugin was searched for later
in the flow that an error was appearent to the client, but the original
root cause of the issue was not found. This CR creates these plugins
outside of stevedore so that issues are immediately raised for
attention, as these represent configuration issues that must be fixed
for proper operation.

Change-Id: I2fd533302ac5e0364aee6e24fd03fcf962c7a3ef
"}]
commit_message:
Expose root cause plugin exceptions

Stevedore was being used to both discover configured plugins and to
create instances of these plugins. If the plugin's __init__() function
raised an exception however, stevedore logged the exception but
otherwise kept processing plugins in the list. The logger also is
disabled so no stack trace is seen in the log file, hence the init
error is swallowed. It wasn't until the plugin was searched for later
in the flow that an error was appearent to the client, but the original
root cause of the issue was not found. This CR creates these plugins
outside of stevedore so that issues are immediately raised for
attention, as these represent configuration issues that must be fixed
for proper operation.

Change-Id: I2fd533302ac5e0364aee6e24fd03fcf962c7a3ef

commit_message:
[VMware] Using ShutdownGuest instead of PowerOffVM_Task, if vmtools was installed.

PowerOffVM_Task is a dangerous operation, while ShutdownGuest are more secure.
Using ShutdownGuest instead of PowerOffVM_Task, if vmtools was installed.
Closes-Bug: #1445858

Change-Id: I7a8aaa3ca993ef997233387d02e26c1dc94fd67b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-14 16:45:49.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volumes.py', 'cinder/api/v2/volumes.py', 'cinder/api/v1/volumes.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py'], 'message': "Fix handling of serialized data in filtering of volumes

Commit 4aaf40ba1aab4d7c347b05750d0fe21f8d1bcc68 has introduced a bug.
'ast.literal_eval(v)' throws exception 'SyntaxError' if 'v' is an expression
such as UUID '920da701-93c1-4178-9f1a-ef1c7a8a384d', 'd-', or 'd+'.
Catch the 'SyntaxError' exception in addition to 'ValueError' and
assume 'v' is a string. So the API can handle the request successfully
rather than returning a '500' error code.

Closes-Bug: #1406504
(cherry picked from commit f39eeebf6eca2745b83a79d2a0def57a126846e7)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volumes.py
	cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py

Change-Id: Ib50cf3be41ae96ed1f9ef0463ced71443e59061c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of serialized data in filtering of volumes

Commit 4aaf40ba1aab4d7c347b05750d0fe21f8d1bcc68 has introduced a bug.
'ast.literal_eval(v)' throws exception 'SyntaxError' if 'v' is an expression
such as UUID '920da701-93c1-4178-9f1a-ef1c7a8a384d', 'd-', or 'd+'.
Catch the 'SyntaxError' exception in addition to 'ValueError' and
assume 'v' is a string. So the API can handle the request successfully
rather than returning a '500' error code.

Closes-Bug: #1406504
(cherry picked from commit f39eeebf6eca2745b83a79d2a0def57a126846e7)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volumes.py
	cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py

Change-Id: Ib50cf3be41ae96ed1f9ef0463ced71443e59061c

subject: Remove install of vlan/vconfig from base
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-08 19:46:19.000000000', 'files': ['elements/base/install.d/00-baseline-environment', 'elements/base/pkg-map'], 'message': "Remove install of vlan/vconfig from base

vconfig is actually deprecated in favor of the ip command, and is not
available on some newer distros (RHEL 7 at least). I'm not honestly sure
why it needs to be installed in all images anyway. I traced the origins
of installing the vlan package here all the way back to the first dib
git import from some other repo...so, I don't see any obvious reason why
it needs to be installed.

Change-Id: I272667cf29f5e41c217a26f70937b2842a04f748
"}]
commit_message:
Remove install of vlan/vconfig from base

vconfig is actually deprecated in favor of the ip command, and is not
available on some newer distros (RHEL 7 at least). I'm not honestly sure
why it needs to be installed in all images anyway. I traced the origins
of installing the vlan package here all the way back to the first dib
git import from some other repo...so, I don't see any obvious reason why
it needs to be installed.

Change-Id: I272667cf29f5e41c217a26f70937b2842a04f748

commit_message:
Allow rexports for targets with Datera

Sometimes due to timing, rexporting a target would fail. This will
verify with Datera if a target already exists, or if it should recreate
an export.

Change-Id: I9c40603cbb525c23e010285bdc66efaaaf4be142
Closes-Bug: #1452838
(cherry picked from commit 76a7bd4bb52e4470307a909ced58b892e7de32c9)

This updates the instance object appropriately which is proper to do and

Change-Id: I1e2753825816016b2b87ae19e7873dbf1d7cb157

commit_message:
Switch to _set_instance_obj_error_state in build_and_run_instance

Since we're guaranteed to have an object in this code path use
_set_instance_obj_error_state rather than _set_instance_error_state.
This updates the instance object appropriately which is proper to do and
also assists testing which checks the state of an object after an error.

Change-Id: I1e2753825816016b2b87ae19e7873dbf1d7cb157

There are multiple features that are only available with qemu.
It makes no sense to have a separate constant for each feature
when they're all looking for the same thing.

There is currently no list of libvirt hypervisor drivers, so

Change-Id: I3b9546debb3c5bdca13926005a7664c701c6fb9a
"}]
commit_message:
unify libvirt driver checks for qemu

There are multiple features that are only available with qemu.
It makes no sense to have a separate constant for each feature
when they're all looking for the same thing.

There is currently no list of libvirt hypervisor drivers, so
we start such a list.  This is not intended to be exhaustive,
but rather only for those drivers that need special handling.

Change-Id: I3b9546debb3c5bdca13926005a7664c701c6fb9a

commit_message:
Use iptables zone to separate different ip_conntrack

ip_conntrack causes security group rule failures when packets share
the same 5-tuple. Use iptables zone option to separate different
conntrack zone. Currently this patch only works for OVS agent.

Co-authored-by: shihanzhang <shihanzhang@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I90b4d2485e3e491f496dfb7bdee03d57f393be35
Partial-Bug: #1359523

subject: Allow for decommissioning a board via a .tombstone file
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-05-09 00:19:56.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/jobs/base.py', 'taskflow/jobs/backends/impl_zookeeper.py'], 'message': 'Allow for decommissioning a board via a .tombstone file

In order to make it possible to stop new postings and
further connections to a decommissioned jobboard
in a clean manner, allow for a .tombstone file to be exist
which will stop a jobboard from being connected to
and stops further postings from occurring if the tombstone
path exists.

It tries to be passive about this and does not stop further
iteration, consuming, claiming on jobs that already exist
on that board (but instead allows for further usage to be
disallowed, making it possible to stop future usage). This
means the board can be offically decommissioned and removed
sometime in the future.

Change-Id: I9c8098b1eee060d9d34f33f68ab56de089245341
'}]
commit_message:
Allow for decommissioning a board via a .tombstone file

In order to make it possible to stop new postings and
further connections to a decommissioned jobboard
in a clean manner, allow for a .tombstone file to be exist
which will stop a jobboard from being connected to
and stops further postings from occurring if the tombstone
path exists.

It tries to be passive about this and does not stop further
iteration, consuming, claiming on jobs that already exist
on that board (but instead allows for further usage to be
disallowed, making it possible to stop future usage). This
means the board can be offically decommissioned and removed
sometime in the future.

Change-Id: I9c8098b1eee060d9d34f33f68ab56de089245341

commit_message:
Allow for skipping the squashing of existing system configs

Setting 'OVERWRITE_SYSTEM_CONF_DIR' to no would allow you to keep a
rolling aio install.

Closes-Bug: 1453234
Change-Id: I48b8632a816709e536b4f644ab8549e896cbe61f

commit_message:
Clean up ComputeManager._get_instance_nw_info

The private method '_get_instance_nw_info' of ComputeManager
make no sense, it just call self.network_api.get_instance_nw_info
again. Remove it, unify all methods of ComputeManager to use
self.network_api.get_instance_nw_info and update the related
test cases.

Remove the asserting admin context logic, because it come from
I5bc35632ca382d011eb42e738140ba54d9cdc93f, it's useless any more.

Change-Id: Ica58122c60c9e2d3e6740d458559ddf4b5a652be

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-05-06 11:48:44.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_async_process.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/test_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_daemon.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/hacking/checks.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/metadata/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/cmd/test_ovs_cleanup.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/test_l2population_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/_test_extension_portbindings.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/metadata/test_driver.py', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': 'Remove use of contextlib.nested

Removed use of contextlib.nested call from codebase, as it has been
deprecated since Python 2.7.

There are also known issues with contextlib.nested that were addressed
by the native support for multiple "with" variables. For instance, if
the first object is created but the second one throws an exception,
the first object's __exit__ is never called. For more information see
https://docs.python.org/2/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.nested
contextlib.nested is also not compatible with Python 3.

This is the first patch in a series for removing use of
contextlib.nested.

Added hacking check to catch if any new instances are added to
the codebase.

Line continuation markers (e.g. '\') had to be used or syntax
errors were thrown. While using parentheses is the preferred way
for multiple line statements, but in case of long with statements
backslashes are acceptable.

Partial-Bug: 1428424
Change-Id: I171fbdb89892a3d4548bf2ca52f4a7dd9ef8dccb
'}]
commit_message:
Remove use of contextlib.nested

Removed use of contextlib.nested call from codebase, as it has been
deprecated since Python 2.7.

There are also known issues with contextlib.nested that were addressed
by the native support for multiple "with" variables. For instance, if
the first object is created but the second one throws an exception,
the first object's __exit__ is never called. For more information see
https://docs.python.org/2/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.nested
contextlib.nested is also not compatible with Python 3.

This is the first patch in a series for removing use of
contextlib.nested.

Added hacking check to catch if any new instances are added to
the codebase.

Line continuation markers (e.g. '\') had to be used or syntax
errors were thrown. While using parentheses is the preferred way
for multiple line statements, but in case of long with statements
backslashes are acceptable.

Partial-Bug: 1428424
Change-Id: I171fbdb89892a3d4548bf2ca52f4a7dd9ef8dccb

commit_message:
Make Docker client timeout configurable

To support long running Docker operations we need to increase our
timeout, but a good value for the timeout will change per deployment.
So, add it as a config option so that it can be tweaked as necessary.

Change-Id: Ie53fa5086e73111bf9f42dbf596172af8d936cf0
Closes-Bug: #1450559

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-23 00:44:48.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/image/image_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/test_image_utils.py'], 'message': "Perform fsync on glance image fetched to tempfile

There's a known bug where sometimes images downloaded from glance to a
file prior to conversion into raw format may end up being corrupted.

The root cause of this is because qemu-img uses fiemap to read blocks
from said file, but it's not using FIEMAP_FLAG_SYNC.  The result is
that if there are blocks in the kernel page_cache that haven't made it
to disk yet, they're skipped in the conversion.

This introduces a workaround config option.  This config option
defaults to True (meaning that the fsync() will happen).  Environments
that have verified they have the fixed version of qemu they can turn
this off.

Distro status can be tracked at:
    https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Bug1368815

Note: this is heavily inspired by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141259
but I can't revive it for some reason.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id6ecf8d8eb34ed15b6c9241aea7b52296328907f
Closes-Bug: #1368815
Co-Authored-By: John Griffith <john.griffith8@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <dims@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Perform fsync on glance image fetched to tempfile

There's a known bug where sometimes images downloaded from glance to a
file prior to conversion into raw format may end up being corrupted.

The root cause of this is because qemu-img uses fiemap to read blocks
from said file, but it's not using FIEMAP_FLAG_SYNC.  The result is
that if there are blocks in the kernel page_cache that haven't made it
to disk yet, they're skipped in the conversion.

This introduces a workaround config option.  This config option
defaults to True (meaning that the fsync() will happen).  Environments
that have verified they have the fixed version of qemu they can turn
this off.

Distro status can be tracked at:
    https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Bug1368815

Note: this is heavily inspired by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141259
but I can't revive it for some reason.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id6ecf8d8eb34ed15b6c9241aea7b52296328907f
Closes-Bug: #1368815
Co-Authored-By: John Griffith <john.griffith8@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <dims@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-05-06 21:47:42.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/policies/blueprints.rst'], 'message': 'Update the specs process for Liberty

This adds explicit wording around the fact we will not use a deadline
for specs submission during Liberty. It also adds wording around the
new requirement for a less heavy-weight template to be filled in
when submitting a spec.

Change-Id: Id54550fb4314117db8fcfea90dd0627899e80c74
'}]
commit_message:
Update the specs process for Liberty

This adds explicit wording around the fact we will not use a deadline
for specs submission during Liberty. It also adds wording around the
new requirement for a less heavy-weight template to be filled in
when submitting a spec.

Change-Id: Id54550fb4314117db8fcfea90dd0627899e80c74

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-02-13 00:43:19.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/pure.py', 'cinder/tests/test_pure.py'], 'message': 'Enabling volume replication on PureISCSIDriver

Purity implements asynch replication using arrays
The smallest unit of replication is a Protection Group(PG)
During setup, a protection group is configured for replication
Adding/removing a volume from a PG adds/removes replication

Refactored all calls to self._array --> self.get_primary_array(volume)
The provider_location property on both volumes and snapshots will be used to store state

Implements: blueprint cinder-pureiscsidriver-volume-replication
Change-Id: I34fb7c5dc071c07575daf24d2fe111cd41518b39
'}]
commit_message:
Enabling volume replication on PureISCSIDriver

Purity implements asynch replication using arrays
The smallest unit of replication is a Protection Group(PG)
During setup, a protection group is configured for replication
Adding/removing a volume from a PG adds/removes replication

Refactored all calls to self._array --> self.get_primary_array(volume)
The provider_location property on both volumes and snapshots will be used to store state

Implements: blueprint cinder-pureiscsidriver-volume-replication
Change-Id: I34fb7c5dc071c07575daf24d2fe111cd41518b39

Volume has a 'readonly' metadata, which has a
default value False. Tenant can use command
"cinder metadata set" to set it to True. This
command updates the database sccessfully. However,
when the tenant shows the volume, the 'readonly'
metadata is still False. This is because 'readonly'
belongs to admin metadata, when tenant updates

commit_message:
Tenant can't set readonly metadata to True

Volume has a 'readonly' metadata, which has a
default value False. Tenant can use command
"cinder metadata set" to set it to True. This
command updates the database sccessfully. However,
when the tenant shows the volume, the 'readonly'
metadata is still False. This is because 'readonly'
belongs to admin metadata, when tenant updates
'readonly' metadata, just change 'volume_metadata'
table in db but not 'volume_admin_metadata'.

Change-Id: I07d3843586e1d1ffe9f1384a9429f471a4f1d100
Closes-Bug: #1421538

commit_message:
Wrong logging when volume type quota exceed

When create a volume type volume, if the quota
has exceed, we can get a QuotaExceed exception.
However, when logging the exception, it compared
with the none type quota, and give a wrong log.

Change-Id: Ice7ac2be5366f6834b9d876d63c573cf51542eb8
Closes-Bug: 1419261
Related-Bug: 1418936

commit_message:
Create a type volume also update none type quota

None volume type quota is always changing when
create a type volume. This is because when update
a type's quota, the none volume type quota is
changed at the same time.

Change-Id: Ieb679b6271f6c1d3e88348994eaf5559e7ae1a76
Closes-Bug: #1418936
Related-Bug: #1419261

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-07 11:27:56.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/rootwrap.conf'], 'message': 'Revert "rtstool on Ubuntu installs in /usr/local/bin"

This reverts commit c85bd876d3ae4b6e29bb040a49e43d3ba46b6039.

cinder-rtstool is installed by setup.py/setup.cfg, the same
way that cinder-api, cinder-volume, etc., are installed.

If it is installing in /usr/local/bin/, that sounds like a
packaging or deployment bug.  The upstream Cinder package
should not have a responsibility to cover /usr/local/bin/.

(Ubuntu packages install this binary correctly in
/usr/bin/ anyway per Ubuntu packaging rules, AFAICT.)

Related-Bug: #1402076
SecurityImpact: rootwrap configuration
Change-Id: Iad1682abb0f2f004f559090358a38a845908fdf4
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "rtstool on Ubuntu installs in /usr/local/bin"

This reverts commit c85bd876d3ae4b6e29bb040a49e43d3ba46b6039.

cinder-rtstool is installed by setup.py/setup.cfg, the same
way that cinder-api, cinder-volume, etc., are installed.

If it is installing in /usr/local/bin/, that sounds like a
packaging or deployment bug.  The upstream Cinder package
should not have a responsibility to cover /usr/local/bin/.

(Ubuntu packages install this binary correctly in
/usr/bin/ anyway per Ubuntu packaging rules, AFAICT.)

Related-Bug: #1402076
SecurityImpact: rootwrap configuration
Change-Id: Iad1682abb0f2f004f559090358a38a845908fdf4

commit_message:
Switch drivers to use execute from cinder utils

Change is needed for use rootwrap daemon helper by drivers.
This change create common interface for command execution,
cinder utils execute will make decision based on config arg,
uses oslo putils or rootwrap daemon client via class helpers
(RootwrapProcessHelper and RootwrapDaemonHelper).

So to use only one approach at the same time, cinder execute
function should be used.

Also related unit tests converted mox -> mock.

Change-Id: Ib019fa18f61f284143f74e9915353c76f557deb0

commit_message:
Add secondary sshpool for san storage drivers

In order to implement volume replication, should add a secondary
ssh connection for communication with the replica storage.

By default, the parameters of the connection such as 'san_ssh_port'
are the same between secondary and primary storage.

DocImpact: another ssh connection for san storage.

Change-Id: Ia19a1cb47019c6a3a4156e81c86592d3e0cb1535

commit_message:
Fix assertEqual argument order in tests/ root dir

The assertEqual using incorrect argument order (observed, expected),
which causes the error message about mismatch to be reversed if the
test case fails. Change it to (expected, observed).

This patch fixes these issues in root dir or cinder/tests. There will
be following patches each fixies a directory in cinder/tests.

Change-Id: I5467520d137426b90cb8f4462b4fd0a1fe1065c0
Partial-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Proof of concept for reset-state-with-driver

Implementation to change python-cinderclient reset-state to
involve the driver. This is a WIP.

This code does not involve a new API for the driver as
originally proposed. Instead, it uses existing calls for
terminate_connection() and detach() when the reset-state
command is used to set state to available.

This patch does not adress Nova issues.
Note that there is a FIXME comment for valid_status that
should be cleaned up before the final patch.

Change-Id: I136b5cb86f247dd2af53c91b5067ee67dc85fe26
Related-Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/reset-state-with-driver

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-16 21:28:27.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_fc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/test_hp3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py'], 'message': 'Fixing 3PAR connection name cache error

The 3PAR driver had a connection name cache in 3PAR common.  If
Cinder was restarted or the common object was destroyed the cache
was lost.  Instead of having the cache in 3PAR common, the 3PAR
driver can query the backend to see if there is a host already
available.  Replacing the name cache with a backend query had minimal
impact on performance of the driver and eliminates the problem of the
cache being destroyed/lost.

Closes-Bug: #1275979
Change-Id: If9a22b64be0b4fd74800dd2f0a4ab421c4c7ede9
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing 3PAR connection name cache error

The 3PAR driver had a connection name cache in 3PAR common.  If
Cinder was restarted or the common object was destroyed the cache
was lost.  Instead of having the cache in 3PAR common, the 3PAR
driver can query the backend to see if there is a host already
available.  Replacing the name cache with a backend query had minimal
impact on performance of the driver and eliminates the problem of the
cache being destroyed/lost.

Closes-Bug: #1275979
Change-Id: If9a22b64be0b4fd74800dd2f0a4ab421c4c7ede9

script tries to populate does not seem to exist.  Fixing script template
to create the entire directory hierarchy rather than just the specific
directory.

subject: Stop installing nose and pylint from distros
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-08 18:05:43.000000000', 'files': ['files/rpms-suse/general', 'files/apts/general', 'files/rpms/general', 'files/apts/horizon', 'files/rpms-suse/swift', 'tools/fixup_stuff.sh', 'files/apts/swift', 'files/rpms/swift', 'files/rpms-suse/horizon', 'files/rpms/horizon', 'README.md'], 'message': "Stop installing nose and pylint from distros

The distro packages of nose and pylint depend on python-setuptools
on some platforms, and on some of those platforms (at least CentOS
6.x) you can't resolve dependencies on python-setuptools properly if
you've forcibly removed it already (as we do on our CI workers). It
appears that any current upstream use of these tools in relation to
DevStack-based testing is now relying on tox and pip to obtain them
instead.

Conflicts:
	files/debs/swift
	files/rpms-suse/general
	files/rpms/general
	files/rpms/horizon

Change-Id: Ibd16ac550c90364115caf57fae4f5f4cb5d5f238
(cherry picked from commit 091b42b7da7650d528bb5f88ec411a04af3da828)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop installing nose and pylint from distros

The distro packages of nose and pylint depend on python-setuptools
on some platforms, and on some of those platforms (at least CentOS
6.x) you can't resolve dependencies on python-setuptools properly if
you've forcibly removed it already (as we do on our CI workers). It
appears that any current upstream use of these tools in relation to
DevStack-based testing is now relying on tox and pip to obtain them
instead.

Conflicts:
	files/debs/swift
	files/rpms-suse/general
	files/rpms/general
	files/rpms/horizon

Change-Id: Ibd16ac550c90364115caf57fae4f5f4cb5d5f238
(cherry picked from commit 091b42b7da7650d528bb5f88ec411a04af3da828)

6.x) you can't resolve dependencies on python-setuptools properly if

Change-Id: Ibd16ac550c90364115caf57fae4f5f4cb5d5f238

commit_message:
Stop installing nose and pylint from distros

The distro packages of nose and pylint depend on python-setuptools
on some platforms, and on some of those platforms (at least CentOS
6.x) you can't resolve dependencies on python-setuptools properly if
you've forcibly removed it already (as we do on our CI workers). It
appears that any current upstream use of these tools in relation to
DevStack-based testing is now relying on tox and pip to obtain them
instead.

Change-Id: Ibd16ac550c90364115caf57fae4f5f4cb5d5f238

commit_message:
Fixes use of dict methods for Python3

In Python3 the dict.keys(), dict.values() and dict.items() methods have
been changed to return iterators instead of lists. This causes issues
with code that expects a list.

bp python3
Change-Id: Id0d55ea4b992666848af1b1a055bc7841548cc6a

commit_message:
Correct multiple DNS servers and tolerate missing NTP

Multiple DNS servers in astute.yaml were not valid input
in the UI because they were missing a comma.

NTP config from system tests removes NTP2 and NTP3 servers.
Modified nailgun settings to permit empty NTP server
configuration.

Change-Id: Ie316e37817e889553840f4923d1426cb54e1589c
Closes-Bug: #1449026

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 07:00:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/hypervisors.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/hypervisors.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_hypervisors.py'], 'message': 'view hypervisor details rest api should be allowed for non-admins

The current call to show hypervisor is broken and expects the
user to have admin privileges always.It does not allow non-
admin users to view hypervisor details. This should be
controlled based on the rule defined in the policy.json rather
than have the permissions mandated programmatically. This bug
is caused due to regression and was working earlier.So the
changes proposed here is merely retaining the older behavior.
To ensure that this works as before, the context passed to the
db api layer is elevated so that it passes the requires_admin_
context check that is present in the db layer.

Change-Id: I50437788aac72608998cf9c24d4d562b1ff20301
Closes-Bug: 1447084
(cherry picked from commit 6be11856c6ac1cbd611cea894a0e26165ee5c5a5)
'}]
commit_message:
view hypervisor details rest api should be allowed for non-admins

The current call to show hypervisor is broken and expects the
user to have admin privileges always.It does not allow non-
admin users to view hypervisor details. This should be
controlled based on the rule defined in the policy.json rather
than have the permissions mandated programmatically. This bug
is caused due to regression and was working earlier.So the
changes proposed here is merely retaining the older behavior.
To ensure that this works as before, the context passed to the
db api layer is elevated so that it passes the requires_admin_
context check that is present in the db layer.

Change-Id: I50437788aac72608998cf9c24d4d562b1ff20301
Closes-Bug: 1447084
(cherry picked from commit 6be11856c6ac1cbd611cea894a0e26165ee5c5a5)

commit_message:
Stop installing nose and pylint from distros

The distro packages of nose and pylint depend on python-setuptools
on some platforms, and on some of those platforms (at least CentOS
6.x) you can't resolve dependencies on python-setuptools properly if
you've forcibly removed it already (as we do on our CI workers). It
appears that any current upstream use of these tools in relation to
DevStack-based testing is now relying on tox and pip to obtain them
instead.

Change-Id: Ibd16ac550c90364115caf57fae4f5f4cb5d5f238
(cherry picked from commit 091b42b7da7650d528bb5f88ec411a04af3da828)

commit_message:
Fix unit tests spam output

Some of unit tests print logs to stdout. Tests output should be clear
and contain only necessary information. Debug output should not be mixed
with tests output.

Change-Id: Ia886998693ce559b270f52c3d9f2ac6062e09a67
Closes-Bug: #1449073

commit_message:
Stop installing nose and pylint from distros

The distro packages of nose and pylint depend on python-setuptools
on some platforms, and on some of those platforms (at least CentOS
6.x) you can't resolve dependencies on python-setuptools properly if
you've forcibly removed it already (as we do on our CI workers). It
appears that any current upstream use of these tools in relation to
DevStack-based testing is now relying on tox and pip to obtain them
instead.

Conflicts:
	files/debs/swift
	files/rpms-suse/general
	files/rpms/general
	files/rpms/horizon

Change-Id: Ibd16ac550c90364115caf57fae4f5f4cb5d5f238
(cherry picked from commit 091b42b7da7650d528bb5f88ec411a04af3da828)

commit_message:
Test live migrate on a paused instance

Nova change Ib38eaf412cb51a9cbfc443c5ec15c5797265ddae adds support for
doing live migration of a paused instance, this adds the test to cover
that scenario.

This also depends on a series of devstack-gate changes to support
multi-host testing in the experimental queue. Specifically, this is
tested in the check-tempest-dsvm-aiopcpu-full job.

Depends-On: I89b7e390bf1cf4f2eccabca2e31a9d1b6b270677

Co-Authored By: "Matthew Gilliard <matthew.gilliard@hp.com>"
Related-Bug: #1305062

Change-Id: I5c6fd3de7ea45d1851bb40037c64ad7fb5e6dc48

commit_message:
beaker/puppet: install bundle before revoking sudo

To install bundle with `gem install`, we need sudo so let's move the
sudo command *before* revoking sudo in the job.

Change-Id: I46505a045c4d2edbe7e87035a94636a645931501

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-05-01 00:09:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Fix disconnect_volume issue when find_multipath_device returns None

During disconnect_volume in LibvirtFibreChannelVolumeDriver there is
a chance that find_multipath_device behaves badly and returns None.
When this happens we end up with a failure as we don't check the
return value from find_multipath_device.

Co-Authored-By: Melanie Witt <melwitt@yahoo-inc.com>
Closes-Bug: #1424968
Change-Id: I5a5c7e26b70df237c7446efe8f99ce2304c41ab4"}]
commit_message:
Fix disconnect_volume issue when find_multipath_device returns None

During disconnect_volume in LibvirtFibreChannelVolumeDriver there is
a chance that find_multipath_device behaves badly and returns None.
When this happens we end up with a failure as we don't check the
return value from find_multipath_device.

Co-Authored-By: Melanie Witt <melwitt@yahoo-inc.com>
Closes-Bug: #1424968
Change-Id: I5a5c7e26b70df237c7446efe8f99ce2304c41ab4

old mechanism for updating.
